statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Phillip Leonard and Jestin Lewis scored 17 points apiece as Mercer opened the season with a 96-70 win over NAIA's Allen on Friday night.
article.headline: Mercer dominates NAIA's Allen 96-70
article.story: MACON, Ga. -- Phillip Leonard and Jestin Lewis scored 17 points apiece as Mercer opened the season with a 96-70 win over NAIA's Allen on Friday night. Leonard also had seven assists and seven rebounds and Lewis had five assists. Ethan Stair and Lawrence Brown chipped in 10 points each for the Bears. Mercer made just 1 of 13 3-point attempts but hit 33 of 61 (54.1%) from the floor while limiting Allen to 20-of-64 shooting. The Bears also won the rebound battle 51-32. Mercer picked up 60 points in the paint while limiting Allen to just 14. Emaray Johnson led Allen with 17 points and Sherod Wade and Derrick McCord added 15 apiece. Donald Marshall, who finished with 7 points, had nine rebounds, five assists and two steals. Mercer had a 13-0 run to lead 35-14 with 3:20 left in the first half and was ahead 42-22 at the break.
